text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

IRM 1.22.4.1, Program Scope and Objectives (1), removed “describes the guidelines and procedures for shipment required in managing IRS programs”; added (5) Primary Stakeholder and (6) Program Goals information per IRM 1.11.2.2.5(4), Address Management and Internal Controls
IRM 1.22.4.1.2, Authority, new section added per IRM 1.11.2.2.5(4), Address

IRM 1.22.4.1.3.1, Chief Financial Officer (CFO)/Financial Management Policy with Financial Reporting, formerly IRM 1.22.4.1.2.1, replaced “Office of Financial Management Policy” with “Office Financial Management Policy with Financial Reporting”, (1) added “with Financial Reporting “ to “Office of Financial Policy”

IRM 1.22.4.1.3.6, Campus Locations and National Distribution Center (NDC)(3)(b), updated email address and fax information; (4) added “for reconciliation” to the end of the ﬁrst sentence; (4) reworded “Within 10 business days after receipt, the POC will complete reconciliation of the OMAS bill and return to W&I/CMO. If there are any discrepancies, the cost centers will document and research the discrepancies between the OMAS bill and monthly expenditures, the cost centers will research and document the ﬁndings. Within 10 business days after receipt, the POC will complete reconciliation of the OMAS bill and return to W&I/CMO”
IRM 1.22.4.1.3.7, Media & Publications (M&P), formerly IRM 1.22.4.1.2.7, (4) updated email address and fax information
IRM 1.22.4.1.4, Program Management and Review, new section added per IRM 1.11.2.2.5(4), Address Management and Internal Controls

IRM 1.22.4.1.5, Program Controls, formerly 1.22.4.1.3, Program Reports, updated per IRM 1.11.2.2.5(4), Address Management and Internal Controls, added (2) “OMAS report (3) “Vendor Meter Reset Report” and (4) “Form 10580-A, Postage Purchase/Expenditure Report”

IRM 1.22.4.1.6, Frequently used Terms and Acronyms, added per IRM 1.11.2.2.5(4), Address Management and Internal Controls, Acronyms was formerly IRM 1.22.4.1.5, that information is now incorporated in IRM 1.22.4.1.6

IRM 1.22.4.1.7, Related Resources, formerly IRM 1.22.4.1.6, Related Resources, renumbered per IRM 1.11.2.2.5(4) Address Management and Internal Controls; (5) General Records Schedule 12: Communication Records”, Added (6) “All IRS forms identiﬁed in these instructions and procedures may be obtained electronically from the M&P intranet website” and (7) “The USPS forms and

IRM 1.22.4.2, Funding and Budget Administration, (3) replace “The postage expense for the non-major cost centers shall be posted within 5 days of purchase” with “The postage expense for the non-major cost centers shall be posted with 10 business days of receipt in the Government Payables and Funds Management office”

IRM 1.22.4.3, Postage Cost Accountability Reporting Requirements for IRS Offices, (5) second sentence, replaced “Within 10 business days” with “Within 5 business days”, third sentence “total variance over 5%” with “total ﬁscal year cumulative variance over 5%”, last sentence replaced “5% tolerance” with “5% total ﬁscal year cumulative tolerance”; (6) updated ﬁrst sentence “5% tolerance” with “5% total ﬁscal year cumulative tolerance”

IRM 1.22.4.3.1, Postage Stamps, (1)(a) replaced “The Local Point of Contact (LPOC) or designee” with “Employees”; (6) updated from “Upon receipt of postage stamps, the LPOC (or designee)” with “Employees”, (6) updated from “Upon receipt of postage stamps, the LPOC (or designee) must prepare Form 10580-A, Postage Purchase /Expenditure Report, and email it to the SPFM within 5 business days” with “Within 5 business days of receipt of the postage stamps, the employee must prepare and submit the following to GPFM and DRB; Form 10580-A, Postage Report, PS 17-G, Federal Agency Stamp Requisition, USPS Stamp Fulﬁllment packing slip”, (7) new information added for email information, the information formerly in (7) is now in (8)
IRM 1.22.4.3.2, Postage Meter Reﬁll/Reset, (2) email and fax information has been removed and relocated to (3); information previously in (3) and (4) are now in (4) and (5).

IRM 1.22.4.7, USPS Express Mail, (2) bulleted “Form 10580-A, Other documentation that lists the dollar amount of the refund check or Postal Money Order, Original PS Form 3533, and Refund check or Postal Money Order” for clarity, replace “Beckley Finance Center, P.O. Box 9--2, Beckley, WV 25802-9002” with “Government Payables and Funds Management, 110 North Heber Street, Beckley

and Reporting Requirements

) Purpose: This IRM provides guidance for the IRS personnel responsible for purchasing and managing postage procured from the United States Postal Service (USPS). It also provides guidance for mailing operations for reporting postal expenses through the Integrated Financial System This guidance addresses speciﬁc types of postage and how two IRS (major cost center and non-major cost center) must report each postage (
) Audience: All IRS employees responsible for purchasing and managing postage from the USPS. (
) Policy Owner: Distribution Requirements resides within the office of Wage Investment (W&I)/Customer Assistance Relationships and Education Media and Publications (M&P)/Distribution (D). (
) Program Owner: Distribution Requirements is the program office for overseeing and providing guidance for Postage Accountability and Reporting Requirements. (
) Primary Stakeholders: • IRS Business Units • Distribution Requirements Branch • Postal and Transport Policy • All employees who use mailing and shipping services (
) Program Goals: To provide IRS USPS guidance to properly obtain postage reconciliation of the postage budget. (

) Proper postage accountability is an IRS priority and an area of focus by Government Accountability Office (GAO) and the Treasury Inspector for Tax Administration (TIGTA). Accurate postage expenditure information critical to identifying opportunities for cost containment and developing postal budget options. (
) The IRS annual USPS expenditures exceed $
Million which is divided among
major costs centers and IRS administrative office locations. The Correspondence Production Service Sites (CPS) are part of the
major centers and are responsible for approximately
% of the annual USPS (

sponsible for providing overall ﬁnancial guidance for postage expenses. Officer Management of Financial Policy with Reporting (
) CFO/FM/GPFM staff: • Enters the obligation into IFS • Enters the advance into IFS • Enters Postage expenses and refunds into IFS • Compares expenses monthly for the
major cost centers to the Payables & spreadsheet and reports discrepancies to W&I/Capital Management Oversight (CMO) Point of Contact (POC) (

) W&I/CMO staff: • Provides accounting string and Agency Cost Code information to Investment Distribution Requirements Branch (DRB) • Receives Notice correspondence volume and costing information from and the M&P/Distribution Office of Taxpayer Correspondence (OTC) and (CMO) Correspondence Publishing Services (CPS) branch • Formulates annual postage estimates with commitment item (e.g., USPS, Transportation and Presort) in consultation with DRB • Provides the major cost centers estimates based on spending trends formulate postal budgets • Notiﬁes the DRB and the USPS by completing Form

, Annual Estimate of Anticipated Penalty Mail Usage, of any adjustments to amount of advance payments • Commits, obligates and monitors transportation funds and works with DRB on an ongoing basis • Provides GPFM the estimated obligation of funds using Form

, Requisition/Obligation Estimate Adjustment Notice • Reviews the advance backup documentation and completes the cation form for posting provided by the GPFM to determine adequacy funds provided • Obtains receipt and acceptance certiﬁcation from the Postal and Transport Policy section and DRB • Downloads monthly USPS expenditure report, converts it to Excel and adds the headers • Divides the report into
sections, prepares

corresponding ation ﬁles and distributes the monthly USPS expenditure report to the major cost centers for reconciliation • Follows up with the reporting offices to determine proper disposition of discrepancies in transaction information • Notiﬁes the GPFM of any changes needed in IFS and provides appro- priate supporting documentation from the affected reporting offices

) W&I/M&P/DRB has the overall leadership of the Mail Management Program and is responsible for the following duties: • Provides guidance and support to the affected stakeholders, expense veriﬁcation, adjustments and reconciliation • Signs Advance Processing Form indicating receipt and acceptance • Disseminates accounting string information to all IRS offices along Agency cost codes • Performs monthly postage expenditure reconciliation based on data of non-major cost centers (
) Correspondence Production Services (CPS) Sites will have a Point of (POC) and an alternate who will account for the respective postage transactions, summaries and reconciliations. (

) The CPS major cost centers will be responsible for compiling and a weekly summary of transactions to the GPFM. This weekly summary is maintained to foster budget planning, veriﬁcation and reconciliations of billings. (
) The
-digit Agency Cost Code must be recorded on all postal documents in appropriate ﬁelds. (
) The date on the form must represent the week ending date. (

) Campus locations and the National Distribution Center (NDC) major cost centers will establish a POC and an alternate who will be responsible for and onciling their respective postage expense transactions, summaries and reconciliations. (
) Monthly, the POC will submit a Form

-A, Postage Report for each postage meter reﬁll. Any supporting documentation such as email from the mailroom or a meter machine receipt that shows the amount added to that particular meter should be retained. (
) If there are no postage transactions for the previous month, a zero-dollar

days of the preceding months end and distribute to the POC for If there are any discrepancies between the OMAS bill and monthly expendi- tures, the cost centers will research and document the ﬁndings. Within

business days after receipt, the POC will complete reconciliation of the bill and return to W&I/CMO. W&I /CMO will follow-up with the cost centers any unresolved discrepancies the following month. If needed, the POC will submit all adjustments separately to GPFM. (

) M&P POC is responsible for tracking the postage usage contracted through the Government Publishing Office (GPO) and are monitored by the Division (PD) with M&P. (

Weekly Summary Report - The week’s accumulation of Daily Transaction Records are compiled and summarized on Form

, Postage Weekly Summary Report. The header information for the weekly report is the Office Location/Cost Accounting Codes. The information includes: • Office Location • Office Location Code • Week ending date (mm/dd/yyyy) format • Agency Cost Code • Accounting String • Mail Classiﬁcation Category as it appears on the USPS postage statement • Mail type - N for notices • Total transaction for each Mail classiﬁcation category • Total amount of transactions for the week OMAS report - submitted by the United States Postal Service (USPS) lists monthly postage expense. Vendor Meter Reset Report - Distribution provides a monthly report to be as a postage aid to complete reconciliation. Form
-A, Postage Purchase/Expenditure Report, is used to postage meters and postage stamp expense. IRS employees who funds on postage meters or to procure postage stamps must submit a Form
-A within
days of expense of postal meter funds, or receipt postage stamps. The following charts contain deﬁned terms and acronyms used IRM:

Weekly Summary Report - The week’s accumulation of Daily Transaction Records are compiled and summarized on Form 13491, Postage Weekly Summary Report. The header information for the weekly report is contained in the Office Location/Cost Accounting Codes. The information includes:
Office Location
Office Location Code
Week ending date (mm/dd/yyyy) format
Agency Cost Code
Accounting String
Mail Classiﬁcation Category as it appears on the USPS postage statement
Mail type
N for notices
Total transaction for each Mail classiﬁcation category
Total amount of transactions for the week
Mail and Transportation Management

Terms Term Deﬁnition Cost Center (formerly Cost Office) The office beneﬁting from the goods or services being acquired. The cost cent captures and analyzes cost information for internal management purposes. Intra-governmental Payment and Collection A standardized interagency fund transfer System (IPAC) mechanism for Federal Program Agencies (FPA). IPAC facilitates the intra-governmental transfer of funds with descriptive data from one FPA to another. Official Mail Accounting Systems (OMAS) The postage accounting system USPS for federal government agencies. Prepaid Expenses Payments made by the IRS to vendors or other federal agencies to cover certain periodic expenses before those expenses are incurred. Acronyms Acronym Deﬁnition ADM Administrative Mail CFO Chief Financial Officer CMO Capital Management and Oversight DRB Distribution Requirements Branch FM Financial Management GAO Government Accountability Office GPFM Government Payables & Funds Management GPO Government Publishing Office IFS Integrated Financial System

) Funding for the purchase of postage resides in the Wage & Investment ﬁnancial plan. Processing the funding activities resides in W&I/Capital ment Oversight (CMO). Reconciliation of the USPS expenditure report and transactions in Integrated Financial System (IFS) are a joint responsibility the cost centers and W&I/CMO with collaborative support of Government Payables & Funds Management (GPFM) as needed. (

) The USPS bills the IRS monthly via the Intra-governmental Payment and lection (IPAC) system for one-twelfth of the yearly postage estimate. The USPS provides W&I, Media and Publications (M&P) and CMO a record of Internal Revenue Manual
All IRS forms identiﬁed in these instructions and procedures can be obtained electronically from M&P intranet website at: href=http://publish.no.irs.gov/catlg.
Mail and Transportation Service’s postage expenditures reported through the USPS Official Mail Ac- counting System (OMAS). In October of the following ﬁscal year, USPS will send a
th IPAC for the previous ﬁscal year which includes the difference between the annual estimate and the actual annual usage. (

) When operating under a continuing resolution (CR) postage obligations will committed and posted in accordance with CR guidance. Upon passage of appropriation bill, postage obligations will be committed and posted advances will be approved by W&I/CMO Finance and posted monthly by GPFM. Expenditures will be posted weekly for the two CPS major cost centers, monthly for M&P and the remaining
major cost centers. The postage expense for the non-major cost centers will be posted within
business days of receipt in the Government Payables and Funds Office. (

send a

th IPAC for the previous ﬁscal year which includes the difference between the annual estimate and the actual annual usage. When operating under a continuing resolution (CR) postage obligations will be committed and posted in accordance with CR guidance. Upon passage of an appropriation bill, postage obligations will be committed and posted quarterly; advances will be approved by W&I/CMO Finance and posted monthly by GPFM. Expenditures will be posted weekly for the two CPS major cost centers, monthly for M&P and the remaining
major cost centers. The postage expense for the non-major cost centers will be posted within
business days of receipt in the Government Payables and Funds Office.
All IRS Offices (except the major cost centers) expending postage funds are required to report postage purchases and expenses on a transactional basis.
Employees must submit a completed PS Form 17-G to the USPS by either fax, email or mail as indicated on the form.

Note: Penalty Mail Stamps are no longer issued by the USPS; mercial Forever stamps are now distributed. Offices may use remaining Penalty Mail stamps until the supply is exhausted. Individual offices are now limited to $
of commercial postage stamps order and a maximum of two orders per month. The requestor must email a copy of the PS Form
-G to services@irs.gov. All exceptions must be approved by contacting DRB at wi.mp.postal.mail. services@irs.gov. Please include the following in your email request: • Copy of PS Form

-G, Federal Agency Stamp Requisition • Justiﬁcation/explanation of need • Whether the stamps will be used by the entire group, a portion of group or an individual • How long will this stamp supply last In the event a supply of stamps is needed due to a natural disaster contact DRB at wi.mp.postal.mail.services@irs.gov for guidance. Within
days of receipt of the postage stamps, the employee must prepare and submit the following to GPFM and DRB: • Form
-A, Postage Purchase/Expenditure Report • PS-

G, Federal Agency Stamp Requisition • USPS Stamp Fulﬁllment packing slip Submit via email to: cfo.bfc.postage.expense.submissions@irs.gov and wi.mp.postal.mail.services@irs.gov, Subject: Postage Stamp Order. A copy of the Form
-A, PS Form

-G and the USPS packing slip be retained by the reporting office. Ordering offices must monitor and ensure all commercial stamps are being used for Official Government Use only. To reﬁll/reset a postage meter, the initiating office must follow the reﬁll/reset procedures as required by the postage meter manufacturer. Upon successful completion of the postage meter reﬁll, the initiating office prepare and submit Form
-A, Postage Purchase/Expenditure Report, the GPFM and DRB within
business days of the postage transaction. Submit via email to: cfo.bfc.postage.expense.submissions@irs.gov and wi.mp.postal.mail.services@irs.gov, Subject: Postage Meter Reﬁll. A copy of Form

-A must be retained by the reporting office along with any USPS certiﬁed postal documents. For locations using the National Mail contract, the Territory Point of Contact (TPOC), or the mail program office responsible for administering and ing the contract must follow the same procedures.
Note: Penalty Mail Stamps are no longer issued by the USPS; com- mercial Forever stamps are now distributed. Offices may use any remaining Penalty Mail stamps until the supply is exhausted.
All exceptions must be approved by contacting DRB at wi.mp.postal.mail. services@irs.gov. Please include the following in your email request:
To reﬁll/reset a postage meter, the initiating office must follow the reﬁll/reset procedures as required by the postage meter manufacturer.

The completed form must accompany the spoiled stamps, meter strips, or envelopes when presented the local Post Office that licensed the meter.
